result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and OWI (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Wayne A Laux was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant eligible for early discharge after 2 years if complies with all conditions of probation and upon Agent's application to the Court.
**Amended 9/29/16 to include attorney fees.
***Amended 6/15/17 - Defendant to be released 6/19/17 for a 1 week furlough.  Defendant to report back on 6/26/17.  Defendant to then serve 60 days.  To be released 8/25/17 for 1 week furlough.  Report back 9/1/17 to serve remaining condition time.
****Amended 7/25/17 to include additional attorney fees.
AODA Assessment and Drivers Safety Plan.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant responsible for attorney fees.  When invoice received and approved, judgment to be amended.
**Amended 9/29/16 to include attorney fee paid thru Agent to the Clerk of Courts.
***Amended 7/25/17 to include additional attorney fees.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this state unless authorized by DMV.
Defendant shall not operate a vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his system.
Defendant shall not operate a vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in his blood.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Court orders segmented sentence - each segment not to exceed 60 days.
Defendant is permitted a furlough so he may attend Zablocki VA Medical Center.  Upon his successful completion of the program, he may serve the balance of jail time, provided he resides at the King Veterans Home, on electronic monitoring.
***Amended 6/15/17 - Defendant to be released 6/19/17 for a 1 week furlough.  Defendant to report back on 6/26/17.  Defendant to then serve 60 days.  To be released 8/25/17 for 1 week furlough.  Report back 9/1/17 to serve remaining condition time.
